subject: Fashion
title: Textile Dyeing Pollution
description: A quick, practical guide to Textile Dyeing Pollution.

hook.text: In parts of China and Bangladesh, you can guess this season's hot color by looking at the rivers.

buildup.text: Textile dyeing uses over 1.3 trillion liters of water yearly, laced with chemicals and heavy metals.

discovery.text: About 20% of global industrial water pollution comes from dyeing and treating fabric.

twist.text: Many dye chemicalsâ€”formaldehyde, lead, mercuryâ€”are carcinogens. Workers handle them bare-handed.

climax.text: The colorful clothes we love leave behind toxic waterways that poison millions downstream.

punchline.text: That vibrant color has a dark side downstream.
